relation: Purchase 133 more Noisebridge T-shirts for $989.29 from Eastbay Screen Print. Purchase 3,000 small and 3000 large Noisebridge stickers for $775.08 from StickerGiant.
That Scud and Chrissy are are barred from Noisebridge. They are prohibited from entering the space or participating in the community.

The treasurer SHOULD open a checking account for Noisebridge at a local credit union, possibly the San Francisco Fire Credit Union, and begin using it as Noisebridge's primary bank account. The current Wells Fargo account should be deprecated and eventually canceled when it is no longer in use.
We recommend to the board that they select Danny to be Treasurer, Tom to be Secretary, and Snail to be President for 2013.
We will reimburse Mitch up to $1000 to replenish our t-shirt supply.
Shawn Landden (photo) is barred from Noisebridge. He is prohibited from entering the space or participating in the community. (Here is some context and here is more context.)
We have agreed the slate for the 2013 board elections.
It is the consensus of Noisebridge that Danny send the DreamworksReply on Noisebridge's behalf.
It is the consensus of Noisebridge that Ping is authorised to send FOIA requests on behalf of Noisebridge for records related to Noisebridge.
Noisebridge officially joins the Open Wireless Movement
Noisebridge renews its lease on the 2169 Mission space, increasing our rent from $3600 to $3960.
I would like Noisebridge to purchase six units of Gorilla racks ($1200-$1800) to be membership shelves.
Tom Lowenthal should replace Danny as the secretary of Noisebridge
It is consensus of Noisebridge that grant specified at Grants/tf2012 be accepted, and the money be used exclusively for paying operating expenses.
That Snail should be President of Noisebridge
Noisebridge should extend the authorization of the Noisetor project indefinitely.
Authorize Treasurer to grant Power of Attorney to the Noisebridge accountant for tax purposes
Rob 2.0 (aka Dank) is barred from Noisebridge. He is prohibited from entering the space or participating in the community.
That we extend the cleaning contract with Skyline Building Care for another six months. They come by at the end of each month, it costs $145 each month.

The treasurer is permitted to spend the money required to accept payments with anything other than PayPal, incorporating an initial startup fee not to exceed $400, followed by a monthly fee not to exceed $100.

Request for up to $300.00 of Noisebridge funds to improve the electronics area infrastructure. Up to $300.00 would be allocated for the cost of material needed to build a 4th electronics bench, an equipment hutch for the bench, and a storage cabinet for the electronics tools at Noisebridge. Any direct donations to support this project would reduce the amount used from Noisebridge funds by an equal amount.
That Noisebridge reimburse Mr SuperQ for the remainder of the cost of the wire trays, after donations this week. (Wire trays cost $930, donations so far $100)

That Noisebridge reimburse Mitch for 6,000 Noisebridge stickers that he bought and paid for from Sticker Giant. 3,000 small Noisebridge stickers: $333.91 + 3,000 large Noisebridge stickers: $421.17 + shipping: $20 -- Total: $775.08
Adopt the Policy Wonks' proposed [codification of our consensus practices].
Adopt the Policy Wonks' proposed [revisions to Hiatus].
That Noisebridge reimburse Mr Shannon for the remainder of the cost of $100 of new keys, after donations this week.
Adopting the Policy Wonks' suggestion for membership expiry
Adopting the Policy Wonks' suggested clarification of the membership application process
Adopting the Policy Wonks' suggestions for how to be a Noisebridge member
Noisebridge should use the approval voting process for Board elections.
In the case of a tie between the election of Noisebridge board candidates, we will use a Roshambo tournament between said parties to decide.
Now that Noisetor has undergone a trial period of operation, Noisebridge should extend the authorization of the Noisetor project for another six months.
Matching funds for Noisetor donations should go to Noisetor.

"Noisebridge pays money out of general funds for a cleaner for a continuing period of three months at a rate of $145 per month; additionally, Rob will do a bi-weekly declutter, coordinated with the arrival of the cleaning people, with lunch paid for by Rubin at a rate of $20 per session; additionally, Ben will clean at the opposite end of the monthly cycle from the cleaners, again coordinating with Rob."
"To spend an amount not to exceed $1000 net after rebate, on a $2000 float to pay a contractor to install more efficient lighting throughout Noisebridge"

Be it the consensus of Noisebridge that the issue of banning Rob 2.0 (a.k.a. Dank) be deferred until either he or his advocate Mitch or Kelly, gives fair notice and attends a meeting. Until that time he is unwelcome at Noisebridge.
"Noisebridge shall order and pay $1500 for t-shirts."

For a trial period of six months, Noisebridge should sponsor an official project to provide Tor nodes, and accept donations earmarked for that purpose. (Noisebridge Tor Project writeup at the time of consensus)
That Noisebridge pays money out of general funds for a cleaner for a trial period of three months, to a maximum of $160 per month.
That NB Make Eric Steinburg A Member
That NB make Danny O'B secretary
Shall Noisebridge order and pay for 50 or 100 or 200 T-shirts to arrive before the San Francisco Maker Faire 21-May-2011?
To bar Patrick Keys (CitizenKeys) from entering the space and participating in the community.
Mitch to spend $775 plus shipping on Noisebridge stickers.
We should consense on what software to use, and the finer points of which form of condorcet to use.

- Nominations are open right now. Any regular member in good standing may put a name forward for nomination for a spot on next year's board. If you fit this criteria and would like to make a nomination, please enter it on this wiki page ( https://www.noisebridge.net/wiki/Board_Nominations_2011 ) along with your name, pseudonym, or wiki signature. - If you're not comfortable using the wiki, I will offer my self up as a proxy that you can contact to have your nomination listed on there. Please email ( jof@thejof.com ) or IM ( jabber: jof@thejof.com ) me with what you'd like listed. My GPG key is 0x8F8CAD3D - Nominations will be open until 23:59 on Thursday, December 23rd 2010. - After the list of candidates is finalized on the 23rd, we'll have some time to mull over our decision and talk with our peers about who's been nominated. Vote submission may also begin at this time. - Any regular, dues-paying member in good standing may vote. - Again, I'm willing to act as a proxy for vote submission. - The mulling-it-over / early voting period ends on Tuesday, January 18th 2011 - On January 18th, 2011, voting will commence after our regular membership meeting. At this time, any remaining votes can be received. Closer to this date, I'll pick a deadline time for vote submission. - After all the votes have been received, I will tally the votes and announce who has won. - Ballots should be made in a ranked list of desired candidates. This ranked list will be tallied using the Condorcet method ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Condorcet_method ) Please let me know if you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions. Otherwise, please nominate whom you wish.
Proposition to ban Rubin Abdi from Noisebridge and all related services.
Proposition to ban Sai from communicating with the press on matters regarding Noisebridge.
Rejected in lieu of private collection.
We decided to use the code that andy wrote.
